questions.title: Question 1 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: The cold water observed along the northern California coast in summer is due mainly to:

mcq.option: D) cold air moving over the water

questions.title: Question 2 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: Upwelling occurs along the northern California coast because:
questions.answer: A) winds cause surface waters to move away from the coast

mcq.option: A) winds cause surface waters to move away from the coast
B) of seismic activity on the ocean bottom
C) of gravitational attraction between the earth and the moon
D) water flows from the Atlantic ocean into the Pacific because they are at different levels

questions.title: Question 3 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.answer: B) the rising of cold water from below

mcq.option: A) the lifting of air along the polar front
B) the rising of cold water from below
C) increasing heights in an upper-level ridge
D) the rising air motion found in a low pressure center

questions.title: Question 4 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: What conditions are necessary for upwelling to occur along the west coast of North America? How does upwelling influence the formation of fog?
questions.answer: Northerly winds along the West Coast cause upwelling. As the deeper colder water rises to the surface it cools the air directly above the water. Fog commonly occurs as the surface air cools to its dew point temperature.

questions.title: Question 5 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: In the general circulation of the atmosphere one would find the region called the doldrums:

questions.title: Question 6 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: Cyclonic flow means ____ in either the Northern or Southern Hemisphere.
questions.answer: C) circulation around a low pressure center

mcq.option: C) circulation around a low pressure center
D) circulation around a high pressure center

questions.title: Question 7 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: In terms of the three-cell model of the general circulation areas of surface low pressure should be found at:

mcq.option: A) the equator and the poles

questions.title: Question 8 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: According to the three-cell general circulation model at the equator we would not expect to find:
questions.answer: B) a ridge of high pressure

mcq.option: B) a ridge of high pressure

questions.title: Question 9 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: Which below is not an assumption of the single-cell model of the general circulation of the atmosphere?
questions.answer: B) the earth rotates once in 24 hours

mcq.option: A) the earth's surface is covered with water
B) the earth rotates once in 24 hours
C) the sun is always overhead at the equator

questions.title: Question 10 for Class CLIMATE102_191009
questions.main: If the coastline shown in the figure below is located in the Southern Hemisphere then upwelling along the coast would occur when the wind blows from the:
